location: The same. Court of Pandarus house.

lines.text: Enter TROILUS and CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Dear, trouble not yourself: the morn is cold.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Then, sweet my lord, Ill call mine uncle down He shall unbolt the gates.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Trouble him not To bed, to bed: sleep kill those pretty eyes, And give as soft attachment to thy senses As infants empty of all thought!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Good morrow, then.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: I prithee now, to bed.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Are you aweary of me

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: O Cressida! but that the busy day, Waked by the lark, hath roused the ribald crows, And dreaming night will hide our joys no longer, I would not from thee.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Night hath been too brief.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Beshrew the witch! with venomous wights she stays As tediously as hell, but flies the grasps of love With wings more momentaryswift than thought. You will catch cold, and curse me.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Prithee, tarry: You men will never tarry. O foolish Cressid! I might have still held off, And then you would have tarried. Hark! theres one up.

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: [Within]  What, s all the doors open here

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: It is your uncle.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: A pestilence on him! now will he be mocking: I shall have such a life!
Enter PANDARUS

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: How now, how now! how go maidenheads Here, you maid! wheres my cousin Cressid

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Go hang yourself, you naughty mocking uncle! You bring me to do, and then you flout me too.

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: To do what to do what let her say what: what have I brought you to do

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Come, come, beshrew your heart! youll neer be good, Nor suffer others.

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Ha! ha! Alas, poor wretch! ah, poor capocchia! hast not slept tonight would he not, a naughty man, let it sleep a bugbear take him!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Did not I tell you Would he were knockd i the head! Whos that at door good uncle, go and see. My lord, come you again into my chamber: You smile and mock me, as if I meant naughtily.
Knocking within

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Ha, ha!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Come, you are deceived, I think of no such thing. How earnestly they knock! Pray you, come in: I would not for half Troy have you seen here.
Knocking within
Exeunt TROILUS and CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Whos there whats the matter will you beat down the door How now! whats the matter
Enter AENEAS

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: Good morrow, lord, good morrow.

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Whos there my Lord AEneas! By my troth, I knew you not: what news with you so early

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: Is not Prince Troilus here

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Here! what should he do here

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: Come, he is here, my lord do not deny him: It doth import him much to speak with me.

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Is he here, say you tis more than I know, Ill be sworn: for my own part, I came in late. What should he do here

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: Who!nay, then: come, come, youll do him wrong ere youre ware: youll be so true to him, to be false to him: do not you know of him, but yet go fetch him hither go.
Reenter TROILUS

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: How now! whats the matter

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you, My matter is so rash: there is at hand Paris your brother, and Deiphobus, The Grecian Diomed, and our Antenor Deliverd to us and for him forthwith, Ere the first sacrifice, within this hour, We must give up to Diomedes hand The Lady Cressida.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: Is it so concluded

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: By Priam and the general state of Troy: They are at hand and ready to effect it.

lines.speaker: troilus
lines.text: How my achievements mock me! I will go meet them: and, my Lord AEneas, We met by chance you did not find me here.

lines.speaker: aeneas
lines.text: Good, good, my lord the secrets of nature Have not more gift in taciturnity.
Exeunt TROILUS and AENEAS

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Ist possible no sooner got but lost The devil take Antenor! the young prince will go mad: a plague upon Antenor! I would they had broke s neck!
Reenter CRESSIDA

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: How now! whats the matter who was here

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Ah, ah!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Why sigh you so profoundly wheres my lord gone! Tell me, sweet uncle, whats the matter

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: O the gods! whats the matter

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Prithee, get thee in: would thou hadst neer been born! I knew thou wouldst be his death. O, poor gentleman! A plague upon Antenor!

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees! beseech you, whats the matter

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone thou art changed for Antenor: thou must to thy father, and be gone from Troilus: twill be his death twill be his bane he cannot bear it.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: O you immortal gods! I will not go.

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Thou must.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: I will not, uncle: I have forgot my father I know no touch of consanguinity No kin no love, no blood, no soul so near me As the sweet Troilus. O you gods divine! Make Cressids name the very crown of falsehood, If ever she leave Troilus! Time, force, and death, Do to this body what extremes you can But the strong base and building of my love Is as the very centre of the earth, Drawing all things to it. Ill go in and weep,

lines.speaker: pandarus
lines.text: Do, do.

lines.speaker: cressida
lines.text: Tear my bright hair and scratch my praised cheeks, Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart With sounding Troilus. I will not go from Troy.
Exeunt
